conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine motion direction.
Graph shows velocity of a particle with time on the y-axis.
Direction of motion is determined by the sign of the velocity.
Velocity is positive in the upward direction, indicating motion in the positive direction.
From 2 to 3 seconds, the graph shows the particle moves from positive to negative velocity.
Negative velocity indicates motion opposite to the positive direction.
Motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the positive direction.
Conclude that the motion direction from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
